channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Mystik Dan wins the Kentucky Derby by a nose
item.description: In a close finish, Mystik Dan won the 150th running of the race on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
In a close finish, Mystik Dan won the 150th running of the race on Saturday.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Renowned painter and pioneer of minimalism Frank Stella dies at 87
item.description: Frank Stella was one of America's leading minimalist artists and a pioneer of the minimalist movement of the early 1960s. The movement challenged the idea that art was meant to be representative.
item.content:encoded:
Frank Stella was one of America's leading minimalist artists and a pioneer of the minimalist movement of the early 1960s. The movement challenged the idea that art was meant to be representative.

(Image credit: Ian Nicholson)
item.dc:creator: Miranda Mazariegos

item.title: NYC says half of those arrested at 2 pro-Palestinian campus protests were not students
item.description: Following the mayor's claims that "outside agitators" escalated protests this week at two Manhattan campuses, city officials released data saying 134 of the 282 people arrested were not students.
item.content:encoded:
Following the mayor's claims that "outside agitators" escalated protests this week at two Manhattan campuses, city officials released data saying 134 of the 282 people arrested were not students.

(Image credit: Julius Motal)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Caitlin Clark shines in her WNBA debut, a preseason sellout
item.description: The NCAA's all-time leading scorer played in her first professional game in the Indiana Fever's match against the Dallas Wings on Friday night. Clark's 21 points were impressive but not enough to win.
item.content:encoded:
The NCAA's all-time leading scorer played in her first professional game in the Indiana Fever's match against the Dallas Wings on Friday night. Clark's 21 points were impressive but not enough to win.

(Image credit: Michael Ainsworth)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 'Zillow Gone Wild' brings wacky real estate listings to HGTV
item.description: Zillow Gone Wild started in 2020 as an Instagram account devoted to eccentric property listings. The show focuses on homes that defy everyday expectations in some way.
item.content:encoded:
Zillow Gone Wild.'/>

Zillow Gone Wild started in 2020 as an Instagram account devoted to eccentric property listings. The show focuses on homes that defy everyday expectations in some way.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Canadian police arrest 3 suspects in the slaying of a Sikh separatist leader
item.description: Police said they arrested three Indian nationals in the slaying of Hardeep Singh Nijjar last June that became the center of a diplomatic spat with India.
item.content:encoded:
Police said they arrested three Indian nationals in the slaying of Hardeep Singh Nijjar last June that became the center of a diplomatic spat with India.

(Image credit: Darryl Dyck)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: More than 16,000 pounds of ground beef sold at Walmart recalled over E. coli risk
item.description: Cargill says that, out "of an abundance of caution," it is recalling several of its ground beef products produced in late April and sold at Walmart locations across the eastern U.S.
item.content:encoded: Cargill says that, out "of an abundance of caution," it is recalling several of its ground beef products produced in late April and sold at Walmart locations across the eastern U.S.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Some cities allow noncitizens to vote in local elections. Their turnout is quite low
item.description: Some cities, like three in Vermont, allow non-U.S. citizens to vote in local elections. In these places, noncitizen turnout has remained low, as noncitizen voting is a contentious national issue.
item.content:encoded:
Some cities, like three in Vermont, allow non-U.S. citizens to vote in local elections. In these places, noncitizen turnout has remained low, as noncitizen voting is a contentious national issue.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Mikaela Lefrak

item.title: She survived the 1970 Kent State shooting. Here's her message to student activists
item.description: On May 4, 1970, the Ohio National Guard fired on Kent State students, killing four and wounding nine. A former student who now teaches there reflects on that day and offers lessons for protesters now.
item.content:encoded: On May 4, 1970, the Ohio National Guard fired on Kent State students, killing four and wounding nine. A former student who now teaches there reflects on that day and offers lessons for protesters now.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: When PTO stands for 'pretend time off': Doctors struggle to take real breaks
item.description: What's a typical vacation activity for doctors? Work. A new study finds that most physicians do work on a typical day off. In this essay, a family doctor considers why that is and why it matters.
item.content:encoded:
What's a typical vacation activity for doctors? Work. A new study finds that most physicians do work on a typical day off. In this essay, a family doctor considers why that is and why it matters.

(Image credit: Wolfgang Kaehler)
item.dc:creator: Mara Gordon
